TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SamlAttribute extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents an attribute that is associated with the subject of a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute> class corresponds to the `<saml:Attribute>` XML element that is defined in the OASIS SAML 1.1 specification.
A <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute> instance contains <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Rights.PossessProperty%2A> claims for the subject of a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement>. For example, a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute> might contain an `Over21` claim, whose type would be specified in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.Namespace%2A> property and whose resource would be specified as a member of the collection in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.AttributeValues%2A> property. When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlStatement.CreatePolicy%2A> method is called, this `Over21` claim is added to the authorization policy that is returned by returned from by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement>. When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.AttributeValues%2A> property contains multiple elements then one claim is returned for each element.
<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute> position in the SAML object hierarchy is:
<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken>
<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion>
<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement>
<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute>
## Examples [!code-csharp[SamlAttribute#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/samlattribute/cs/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[SamlAttribute#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/samlattribute/vb/source.vb#1)]

Docs.param: A that represents an attribute of the subject for a security token.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified claim.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this constructor to convert a claim into a SAML attribute. To be converted to a SAML attribute, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim.Right%2A> property must be <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Rights.PossessProperty%2A>, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim.Resource%2A> property must be of type <xref:System.String>, and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim.ClaimType%2A> property must be in the format `namespace/name`.
The following table specifies what the `claim` parameter sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.Name%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.Namespace%2A>, and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.AttributeValues%2A> properties to.
|Property|Property of the `claim` parameter used to set the property| |--------------|----------------------------------------------------------------| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.AttributeValues%2A>|The value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim.Resource%2A> property is added to the collection.| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.Name%2A>|The portion of the string after the last '/' character in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim.ClaimType%2A> property.| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.Namespace%2A>|The portion of the string before the last '/' character in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim.ClaimType%2A> property.|

Docs.exception:
The property of is not of type .
-or-
The property of is not .
-or-
The property of does not have a '/' character or it is in the first or last index positions.

Docs.value: A that contains the set of attribute values for the SAML attribute.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A SAML attribute may contain more than one attribute value.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.AttributeValues%2A> property corresponds to the `<saml:AttributeValue>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.AttributeValueXsiType%2A> property corresponds to the `type` attribute of the `<saml:AttributeValue>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification. This attribute is required.

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of claims that this SAML attribute represents.
Docs.returns: A of type that contains the set of claims that this SAML attribute represents.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens specify their claims using SAML assertions that can specify an attribute about the subject represented by the security token. Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.ExtractClaims%2A> method to convert the SAML attribute into a set of claims.

remarks.format:
## Remarks To specify the values associated with this SAML attribute, set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.AttributeValues%2A> property
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.Name%2A> property corresponds to the `AttributeName` attribute of the `<Attribute>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.

remarks.format:
## Remarks To set the name of the SAML attribute, set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.Name%2A> property.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute.Namespace%2A> property corresponds to the `AttributeNamespace` attribute of the `<AttributeDesignator>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
